definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: Astrologers think of the water-bearer as pouring life-enhancing energy into the ether.
sentences.chinese: 占星學家認爲這個水瓶，是將生命的能量注入靈性。

sentences.english: Astrology is a trusted science and is being practiced for over 4000 years," said an affidavit filed by Dr R Ramakrishna, deputy drug controller (India), west zone.
sentences.chinese: 占星術是被信服的科學，已被實踐了4000多年。

sentences.english: Astrologically, I observe that Saturn is in Leo.
sentences.chinese: 從占星學角度來說，我觀察到土星的位子處於獅子座。

sentences.english: Otherwise the astrologer should make an appropriate referral.
sentences.chinese: 否則，占星家應作出適當的轉介。

sentences.english: The dates are, in fact, astronomical, astrological and astrotheological.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個日期是天文學，占星術和星相學。

sentences.english: Astrologers today look to both planets to see what is coming up for you.
sentences.chinese: 如今占星師共同觀察它們來預言你的未來。

sentences.english: We astrologers have known all about this for ages.
sentences.chinese: 我們占星師長期以來就知道與它有關的一切。

sentences.english: Both astronomers and astrologers agree on this bit.
sentences.chinese: 在這一點上天文學家和占星家暫時可以握手言和。

sentences.english: To wit, Christ's death and resurrection are based on astrotheology.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，基督的死亡和復活是基於占星神學。

sentences.english: So the astronomers don't like astrologers.
sentences.chinese: 所以天文學家不喜歡占星師。

sentences.english: Astrological signs calculated according to the Julian calendar.
sentences.chinese: 占星符號是依照羅馬儒略曆來計算的。

sentences.english: So, the problem with astrological predictions is not that they're wrong.
sentences.chinese: 占星預測的問題並不在於它們是錯誤的。

sentences.english: You don't have to be an astrologer to use this information.
sentences.chinese: 並非占星師纔可以應用這些信息。

sentences.english: He had his history and astrology all mixed up.
sentences.chinese: 他把歷史和占星學都搞混了。
鍊金術受到了占星術影響。

definition: seven heavenly bodies and four imaginary stars (in astrology and feng shui)
aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
to divine using the trigrams/fortune telling

the twelve equatorial constellations or signs of the zodiac in Western astronomy and astrology, namely: Aries 白羊[Bai2 yang2], Taurus 金牛[Jin4 niu2], Gemini 雙子|双子[Shuang1 zi3], Cancer 巨蟹[Ju4 xie4], Leo 獅子|狮子[Shi1 zi3], Virgo 室女[Shi4 nu:3], Libra 天秤[Tian1 cheng4], Scorpio 天蠍|天蝎[Tian1 xie1], Sagittarius 人馬|人马[Ren2 ma3], Capricorn 摩羯[Mo2 jie2], Aquarius 寶瓶|宝瓶[Bao3 ping2], Pisces 雙魚|双鱼[Shuang1 yu2]
